column.name: a_label
column.remarks: Name of the actor (can be a person or an entity)

column.name: a_login
column.remarks: Login of the actor. It is the unique identifier of the actor. Only needed for actors having the category 'platform_user'.

table.name: deleted_data_log
table.remarks: Log of deleted objects from observation table. Use for synchronization purpose

column.name: de_table
column.remarks: Source table of the deleted object: observation

column.name: de_uid
column.remarks: Unique text identifier of the object. Observation: ob_uid

table.name: dimension
table.remarks: Stores the different dimensions characteristics of an indicator

column.name: di_code
column.remarks: Code of the vector dimension. Ex: 'pop_h' or 'pop_f'

column.name: di_label
column.remarks: Label of the vector dimensions. Ex: 'population homme' or 'population femme'

column.name: di_type
column.remarks: Type of the stored values. Ex: 'integer' or 'real'

column.name: di_unit
column.remarks: Unit ot the store values. Ex: 'inhabitants' or '°C'

table.name: document
table.remarks: List of documents for describing indicators.

column.name: do_label
column.remarks: Label of the document, used for display. Must be unique

column.name: do_path
column.remarks: Relative path of the document to the project storage. Ex: media/indicator/documents/indicator_weather_status_description.pdf

table.name: glossary
table.remarks: List of labels and words used as labels for stored data

column.name: gl_field
column.remarks: Target field for this glossary item

column.name: gl_code
column.remarks: Item code to store in tables

column.name: gl_label
column.remarks: Item label to show for users

column.name: gl_order
column.remarks: Display order among the field items

table.name: graph_node
table.remarks: Graph nodes, to store key words used to find an indicator.

table.name: indicator
table.remarks: Groups of observation data for decisional purpose.

column.name: id_description
column.remarks: Describes the indicator regarding its rôle inside the project.

column.name: id_date_format
column.remarks: Help to know what is the format for the date. Example : ‘year’

column.name: id_paths
column.remarks: Paths given to help finding an indicator. They will be split up to fill the graph_node and r_indicator_node tables. If you need multiple paths, use | as a separator. Ex: Environment / Water resources | Measure / Physics / Water

column.name: id_category
column.remarks: Category of the indicator. Used to group several indicators by themes.

table.name: metadata
table.remarks: Metadata of the structure : version and date. Usefull for database structure and glossary data migrations between versions

column.name: me_status
column.remarks: Status of the version. 1 means active version, 0 means older version

table.name: observation
table.remarks: Les données brutes au format pivot ( indicateur, date, valeurs et entité spatiale, auteur, etc.)

column.name: fk_id_spatial_object
column.remarks: ID of the object in the spatial object table

column.name: ob_value
column.remarks: Vector containing the measured or computed data values. Ex : [1543, 1637]

column.name: ob_start_timestamp
column.remarks: Start timestamp of the observation data

column.name: ob_validation
column.remarks: Date and time when the data has been validated (the corresponding import status has been changed from pending to validated). Can be used to find all observations not yet validated, with NULL values in this field.

column.name: ob_end_timestamp
column.remarks: End timestamp of the observation data (optional)

table.name: project
table.remarks: List of projects, which represents a group of indicators

column.name: pt_lizmap_project_key
column.remarks: Lizmap project unique identifier (optional): repository_code~project_file_name. Ex: environment~weather

column.name: pt_label
column.remarks: Human readable label of the project. Ex: Weather data publication

column.name: pt_indicator_codes
column.remarks: List of indicator codes available for this project

table.name: project_view
table.remarks: Allow to filter the access on projects and relative data (indicators, observations, etc.) with a spatial object for a given list of user groups. There must be at least one project view for the project, of type global. The other views must be of type filter.

column.name: pv_groups
column.remarks: List of user groups allowed to see observation data inside this project view spatial layer object. Use a coma separated value. Ex: "group_a, group_b"

column.name: pv_type
column.remarks: Type of the project view : "global" for the unique global view, and "filter" for the view made for spatial filter purpose

column.name: geom
column.remarks: Geometry of the project view: no observation can be created outside the project views geometries accessible from the authenticated user.

column.name: pr_description
column.remarks: Description, including URLs to references and authors.

column.name: pr_days_editable
column.remarks: Number of days the observations from series related to the protocol are editable (delete & update) after creation. Use a very long value such as 10000 if the editing can occur at any time. The control is made based on the observation created_at column

table.name: r_indicator_node
table.remarks: Pivot table between indicators and nodes

column.name: fk_id_actor
column.remarks: Actor, source of the observation data.

column.name: fk_id_indicator
column.remarks: Indicator. The series is named after the indicator.

column.name: fk_id_spatial_layer
column.remarks: Spatial layer, mandatory. If needed, use a global spatial layer with only 1 object representing the global area.

table.name: spatial_layer
table.remarks: List the spatial layers, used to regroup the spatial data. Ex : cities, rivers, stations

column.name: sl_code
column.remarks: Unique short code for the spatial layer

column.name: sl_geometry_type
column.remarks: Type of geometry (POINT, POLYGON, MULTIPOLYGON, etc.)

table.name: spatial_object
table.remarks: Contains all the spatial objects, caracterized by a geometry type and an entity

column.name: so_unique_id
column.remarks: Unique code of each object in the spatial layer ( INSEE, tag, etc.)

column.name: so_unique_label
column.remarks: Label of each spatial object. Ex : name of the city.

column.name: geom
column.remarks: Geometry of the spatial object. Alway in EPSG:4326

column.name: so_valid_from
column.remarks: Date from which the spatial object is valid.

column.name: so_valid_to
column.remarks: Date from which the spatial object is not valid. Optional: if not given, the spatial object is always valid

column.name: so_uid
column.remarks: Spatial object uid: autogenerated unique identifier

routine.name: control_observation_editing_capability()
find_observation_with_wrong_spatial_object(_id_series integer)
routine.comment: Find the observations with having incompatible start and end timestamp with related spatial objects validity dates
routine.definition:
BEGIN RETURN QUERY SELECT o.ob_uid, s.so_unique_id FROM gobs.observation AS o INNER JOIN gobs.spatial_object AS s ON s.id = o.fk_id_spatial_object WHERE True -- the same series AND o.fk_id_series = _id_series -- wrong start (and optional end) dates compared to validity dates of linked spatial object AND ( ob_start_timestamp NOT BETWEEN Coalesce('-infinity'::timestamp, so_valid_from) AND Coalesce(so_valid_to, 'infinity'::timestamp) OR ( ob_end_timestamp IS NOT NULL AND ob_end_timestamp NOT BETWEEN Coalesce('-infinity'::timestamp, so_valid_from) AND Coalesce(so_valid_to, 'infinity'::timestamp) ) ) ;
END;

routine.name: log_deleted_object()
manage_object_timestamps()
parse_indicator_paths(i_id integer, i_path text)
trg_after_import_validation()
trg_parse_indicator_paths()
update_observation_on_spatial_object_change()
update_observations_with_wrong_spatial_objects(_id_series integer)
routine.comment: Update observations with wrong spatial objects: it search the observation for which the start and end timestamp does not match anymore the related spatial objects validity dates. It gets the correct one if possible and perform an UPDATE for these observations. It returns a line with 2 integer columns: modified_obs_count (number of modified observations) and remaining_obs_count (number of observations still with wrong observations

routine.name: update_spatial_object_end_validity()
